topic.name: Composition & Arranging
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Composition & Arranging in Fine Arts

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the beginning, middle, and end of a song.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Identify when a song comes to a rest.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the 12-bar blues pattern.
Identify the sound of a trumpet, violin, and drum.
Name 'Timbre' as the color of the sound.
Identify percussion instruments.
Identify the main tune in a song.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Name the parts as 'Same' or 'Different'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a Theme and Variation.
Identify the Chorus (the part that repeats).
Identify one voice singing alone.
Name when everyone sings the same thing (Unison).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Using Music Technology (DAWs, Notation Software, MIDI sequencing)
objectives.objective_text: Identify sounds made by computers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that chords change.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that some chords pull to others.
Recall that big instruments sound low.
Observe families of instruments (Strings, Brass, etc.).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Recall ABA form (Sandwich).
Recall that songs tell stories.
Recall when instruments play different parts.
Observe thick vs. thin sounds.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Using Music Technology (DAWs, Notation Software, MIDI sequencing)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that music can be saved as a file.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Sing a bass line (roots) for a simple song.
Explain orchestration basics.
Write a simple 4-line lyric with rhymes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Using Music Technology (DAWs, Notation Software, MIDI sequencing)
objectives.objective_text: Use a simple app to make a beat.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the Plagal Cadence (Amen cadence).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Authentic Cadence (V-I).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Explain modulation (changing key).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the rules of voice leading in progression.
Summarize the range of Soprano, Alto, Tenor, Bass.
Explain why a flute sounds different from a clarinet.
Choose instruments to tell a story (e.g., Peter and the Wolf).
Defend choices of instrumentation based on genre.
Invent a short song.
Repeat a musical phrase.
Change the ending of a familiar song.
Summarize what a 'Motif' is (a musical idea).
Explain Question and Answer phrases.
Compose a melody for a poem.
Explain how to develop a motif.
Defend the aesthetic value of melodic coherence.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Move differently for different sections.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Binary (AB) vs. Ternary (ABA) form.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Explain Rondo form (ABACA).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Map out the structure of a hymn (Verse/Chorus).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Coda.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the use of form to guide the listener.
Make up words to a known tune.
Clap the rhythm of the words.
Summarize the difference between Verse (story) and Chorus (main idea).
Explain what a 'Hook' is (catchy part).
Explain the Pre-Chorus.
Defend the marriage of text and tune.
Summarize Monophony (one line) vs. Polyphony (many lines).
Explain Homophony (melody with chords).
Sing a round (canon) like 'Row, Row, Row Your Boat'.
Explain heterophony (variations of same melody).
Defend the clarity of individual lines.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret Deceptive Cadences (V-vi).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Connect harmonic rhythm to pacing.
Analyze the transposing nature of some instruments (e.g., Bb Trumpet).
Interpret the capabilities and limitations of instruments.
Connect timbre to mood.
Analyze the use of sequence (moving a pattern up or down).
Interpret the contour of a melody.
Connect repetition to unity and variation to interest.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze Sonata-Allegro form (Exposition, Development, Recapitulation - intro).

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the bridge in a pop song.

objectives.objective_text: Connect form to architectural structure.
Interpret the function of a Bridge (change/lift).
Connect lyrics to melodic contour (prosody).
Compare a solo with a choir.
Analyze the texture of a fugue.
Interpret the independence of voices in counterpoint.
Connect texture to clarity in composition.

objectives.objective_text: Defend the use of technology as a tool for stewardship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the emotional impact of specific harmonic shifts.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the structural unity of a large work.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the production quality of a mix.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Create a simple accompaniment.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a sophisticated chord progression with substitutions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Harmonic Progression (Cadences, 12-Bar Blues, Circle of Fifths)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize harmonic theory in an original composition.
Construct an arrangement for a specific ensemble.
Synthesize knowledge of range and timbre in arranging.
Construct a fully developed melody with a climax.
Synthesize melodic writing with harmonic support.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a composition in a specific classical form.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Musical Form & Structure (Binary AB, Ternary ABA, Rondo ABACA, Theme & Variations)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize coherence and contrast in formal design.
Create a melody for a Bible verse.
Analyze the structure of a contemporary worship song.
Construct a complete song with lyrics and chord chart.
Synthesize poetry and music composition.
Construct a contrapuntal passage (e.g., 2-part invention).
Synthesize textural changes for dramatic effect.

objectives.objective_text: Construct a multi-track recording in a DAW.
